snippet: A request filed with the Federal Election Commission asks to employ tactics Republican presidential candidates have pioneered, and could force a ruling on their legality.
abstract: Democrats plan bigger role for its network of 'super PACs'; party's lawyers file request with Federal Election Commission seeking to clarify what is legal in campaign fund-raising, with plans to create batch of new super PACs for individual House and Senate candidates; tactic was pioneered by Republican presidential candidates, who raised hundreds of millions of dollars for 2016 campaign using such groups.
lead_paragraph: A request filed with the Federal Election Commission asks to employ tactics Republican presidential candidates have pioneered, and could force a ruling on their legality.

headline.main: Democrats Lay Groundwork to Expand Use of ‘Super PACs’
headline.print_headline: Democrats Plan Increased Role for ‘Super Pacs’
